Stewart Smith describes himself as a  in Army ROTC PERIOD He enjoys the program and has looked forward to graduating and receiving a commission as a second lieutenant PERIOD Until now that is PERIOD

In August Smith juniorenvironmental resources management learned from his ROTC instructor that he will not be able to sign a contract to serve as a U.S PERIOD Army officer PERIOD

The University Army ROTC program has limited the number of contracts it offers cadets in accordance with a cap on cadet commissions nationwide said Lt PERIOD Col PERIOD Michael Caudle deputy commander of the Penn State Army ROTC Battalion PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Army ROTC contracts are binding agreements between a cadet and the Army in which the Army provides funds for the cadets tuition book fees and a subsistence allowance Caudle said PERIOD In exchange the cadet agrees to pursue a commission as a second lieutenant in the Army by getting a college degree meeting physical requirements and agreeing to an eightyear commitment PERIOD

The U.S PERIOD Department of Defense and the commander of the U.S PERIOD Army ROTC Cadet Command instituted the ceiling Caudle said because cuts in the defense budget and recent events in Eastern Europe have eliminated the need for them PERIOD

The Persian Gulf crisis may reverse these manpower cuts but it is too soon to tell how it would affect ROTC programs Caudle said PERIOD

 Caudle said PERIOD

The cap is unfair because thirdyear cadets had no warning the ceiling was going into effect Smith said PERIOD

 Smith said PERIOD 

How long the ceiling will remain depends on the Defense Departments needs as well as Congressional funding said Lt PERIOD Col PERIOD Michael Geoghagan professor of military science for the University of Pittsburghs Army ROTC program PERIOD

John Vaughn is a thirdyear cadet who is not on a scholarship and cannot sign a contract PERIOD ROTC instructors told him his options are to  if a slot opens up or to quit the ROTC program he said PERIOD

Vaughn juniorinternational politics plans to stay in it as long as he can hoping that a slot will open up PERIOD

 Vaughn said PERIOD 

This years ceiling affects those cadets scheduled to receive commissions in the  fiscal year most of whom are now juniors Caudle said PERIOD

This year Penn State Army ROTC can offer contracts to seven thirdyear cadets with nursing majors and  thirdyear cadets with other majors he said PERIOD

Lt PERIOD Col PERIOD Caudle said many thirdyear cadets have ROTC scholarships and signed a contract when they received them PERIOD

Penn States Army ROTC instructors have placed the nonscholarship cadets on an merit list PERIOD The commander of the third Brigade of the first Army ROTC Region which comprises Pennsylvania has compiled a statewide list from each school PERIOD When a slot opens up contracts are offered to cadets from the top of this list Caudle said PERIOD

Penn State scholarship cadets dont exceed the ceiling for  but additional contracts will be offered to top cadets on the states merit list Caudle said PERIOD

Since there are more cadets in Pennsylvania on scholarships than there are slots nonscholarship cadets will not be offered contracts unless some scholarship cadets violate their contracts Caudle said PERIOD

Contract violations include medical disqualifications and failure to meet academic requirements he said PERIOD

Jeff Wood a fourth year cadet who is already contracted said that most Penn State cadets think the ceiling is unfair PERIOD
